title: Issues since 4.21
body:
Ever since patch 4.21 was released, I have been having a ridiculous amount of problems. I have covered everything from firewall errors to league crashing my computer and forcing me to hard reset. Ive even had to reinstall League to fix frame rate problems that still occur, which I now know deleting the file game.cfg also fixes that issue, temporarily. Every time I try to contact support, they blame my computer and honestly, that is getting old.

You know how I know it isn't my computer? Riot doesn't care, so they can skip this paragraph. I play Steam games as well as league, and if I can run Tropico 5 max settings (a game that came out not even 3 months ago) and have absolutely no problems, my computer is fine. I play everything from Fallout to Garry's Mod, and I don't have any issues of any kind with any other game but League. So for once, can Riot please stop saying it is my computer and take this seriously?

There is a problem somewhere in League's code that doesn't like Windows 8.1, or some part of my hardware. Maybe my computer is to advanced and modern for League, or maybe my drivers are updated beyond what League is capable of. I keep my system in good health, running all the maintenance it needs when it needs it, not to much and not to little. I don't have any clue as to why League has these problems, but somewhere along the line, it does and Riot doesn't seem to want to admit it.

I also know I am not alone. I can easily google some of the issues I have and there are forums on websites from gamespot to the very boards you are on now, all with people sharing the same problem I have experienced recently. Whether this gets attention or not, I have no idea and cant control that. All I want is for Riot to accept there is a problem, and perhaps try to resolve it. Game balance is great, new content is great, but whats the point when the game itself has problems that limit some people's ability to even play?

This may be just another rant from a person who has run out of patience, but I am posting this because it makes me feel better knowing Riot MIGHT read this, and also that other people with similar problems might come across this and bring it to Riot's attention. I love League, both the gameplay and the lore behind it, but it is very difficult to enjoy a game that has bipolar.exe syndrome. It might work, it might not work, who knows? If it doesn't want to work today, have fun getting busted by leaverbuster!

And yes, I am done now.{{summoner:3}}

replies.body:
Hey Senpai Roadkill!

I took the time to read your entire post (even the paragraph you said that we can "skip" -- btw, how is Tropico 5?  Heard some good things, but not sure if I should pick it up on Steam) and it sounds that you have had some pretty frustrating issues.  Let me see if I can help!

We don't want to automatically blame you and say that your computer is at fault.  However, when we work on troubleshooting an issue, we want to eliminate as many possible root causes as possible.  This means that we will want you to take steps on your specific computer so we know that it isn't the real issue here.

To get a better idea as to what is going on, can you reply back and attach your [DxDiag ](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752674-Network-System-and-League-of-Legends-Logs#jwq5)and [R3d Log](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752674-Network-System-and-League-of-Legends-Logs#jwq7)?  It will allow me to review it and go from there!

> [{quoted}](name=dArtagnan,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=78Oum4MU,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2014-12-15T22:33:26.657+0000)

> 
> I took the time to read your entire post (even the paragraph you said that we can "skip" -- btw, how is Tropico 5?  Heard some good things, but not sure if I should pick it up on Steam) and it sounds that you have had some pretty frustrating issues.  Let me see if I can help!
> 
> We don't want to automatically blame you and say that your computer is at fault.  However, when we work on troubleshooting an issue, we want to eliminate as many possible root causes as possible.  This means that we will want you to take steps on your specific computer so we know that it isn't the real issue here.
> 
> To get a better idea as to what is going on, can you reply back and attach your [DxDiag ](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752674-Network-System-and-League-of-Legends-Logs#jwq5)and [R3d Log](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752674-Network-System-and-League-of-Legends-Logs#jwq7)?  It will allow me to review it and go from there!

Well, some of the issues have been resolved but some are only rare occurrences. The R3d log I attached is from a game that went fine, but I have one game where League locked up my entire computer forcing me to reboot. The R3d file for that game is 136,240 KB and I cannot attach it because it is to large of a file. 

And thank you for taking the time to reply {{summoner:31}} 

As for Tropico 5, I love it! The 4 player online is a bit buggy, not sure if that ever got patched yet, but 3 players is just as fun.


*EDIT: I opened up the R3d log that was 136 MB and after scrolling for some few minutes, I only saw the same thing over and over. it was like it was stuck in an infinite loop. If you would like, I can include some copy/paste from it but I have no idea how I would send you the entire log. My email wont even let me send a 136MB file xD
There is also another game from the other day that did the same thing to my computer, forcing me to reboot. The R3d file from that game is 147 MB. I may not be a programmer, but judging by the averagee file size of less than 1,000 KB, these logs are absurdly large.

Additionally, I am running league in compatibility mode for Windows 7. I have been doing this since I upgraded to Windows 8.1 but this problem only just started in the past week. (I have had 8.1 for months now)

I took a look at your logs and two things immediately jump out at me as big red flags:

1) Your DxDiag shows you running an integrated Intel Graphics Card.  Do you have an Nvidia or AMD dedicated Graphics Card as well?  Or is it just your integrated card?

2) Your R3d Log shows that League of Legends was not able to detect that you have a Graphics Card installed -- which is probably the main reason for the crashes. This usually means the drivers are corrupted/severly out of date.  However, in order to update them, we need to make sure that question #1 is answered.

Respond back with any information you can so we can dig into this a bit more!

Some samplings from my gigantic R3D Log file (it's over 100 MBs!)

First, just to prove mine is seeing my card:

000005.081|       0.0000kb|      0.0000kb added| ALWAYS| Display info: NVIDIA GeForce GTX 660 Ti 2147483648 9.18.13.4475

This error repeats literally hundreds or thousands of times in the log (I replaced the less than signs with {):

Function: Riot::Animation::CompressedAnimResource::Evaluate

Expression: t0 {= time16 && time16 {= t1
000635.352|       0.0000kb|      0.0000kb added|  ERROR| Assertion failed!

File: E:/jenkins/workspace/game-code-Releases-4-21-public-win32/code/Game/Engine/RiotAnimation/Resource/CompressedAnimResource.cpp
Line: 222

Function: Riot::Animation::CompressedAnimResource::Evaluate

Expression: t0 {= time16 && time16 {= t1
000635.352|       0.0000kb|      0.0000kb added|  ERROR| Assertion failed!

File: E:/jenkins/workspace/game-code-Releases-4-21-public-win32/code/Game/Engine/RiotAnimation/Resource/CompressedAnimResource.cpp
Line: 233

Function: Riot::Animation::CompressedAnimResource::Evaluate

Expression: t0 {= time16 && time16 {= t1
000635.352|       0.0000kb|      0.0000kb added|  ERROR| Assertion failed!

File: E:/jenkins/workspace/game-code-Releases-4-21-public-win32/code/Game/Engine/RiotAnimation/Resource/CompressedAnimResource.cpp
Line: 244

My E drive is a virtual drive with a Japanese game CD in it. Why is E being constantly referenced here? And what's jenkins?

R3d Logs are incredibly useful, but usually for more macro level understandings of the computer configuration, or at what point did a crash/disconnect occur.

Specific entries in the R3d Logs don't necessarily indicate a particular issue at all, which is why reviewing a full R3d log is super helpful, as opposed to just snippets. As to why so many "error" notifications exist in R3d Logs causing the file size to be so huge....that's a good question!  We are actually working on removing a lot of superfluous log entries.

If your still experiencing consistent issues with crashing in-game, make sure to [submit a new ticket](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) to our Tech Team, and attach these R3d Logs as well as your DxDiag so we can investigate further!

> [{quoted}](name=dArtagnan,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=78Oum4MU,comment-id=00010000000000020000,timestamp=2014-12-16T19:17:05.830+0000)

> R3d Logs are incredibly useful, but usually for more macro level understandings of the computer configuration, or at what point did a crash/disconnect occur.
>

As to why so many "error" notifications exist in R3d Logs causing the file size to be so huge....that's a good question!  We are actually working on removing a lot of superfluous log entries.
> 
> If your still experiencing consistent issues with crashing in-game, make sure to [submit a new ticket](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) to our Tech Team, and attach these R3d Logs as well as your DxDiag so we can investigate further!

Well, I submitted a ticket but the R3d logs could not be attached unfortunately. However, I did learn something that maybe someone with more tech knowledge might be able to explain to me?

I read that Alienware system use both an intel integrated graphics card and the NVidia graphics card, which both have drivers that can work together to complete various tasks. What I think I understood from that is if I updated to the news NVidia drivers from the NVidia website, maybe the drivers I downloaded don't support this Alienware feature and since the two cards are not working together properly, it is the cause for various games to crash. 

I also can confirm that League is not the only game crashing on me anymore. I had Fallout NV crash on me today as well, with the exact same symptoms I get when League crashes. I no longer believe it is League, but if anyone knows more about this, any and all help will be greatly appreciated.



As a side note, I don't want to delete drivers and install older ones unless I know for sure it will fox this. While I can do it, I am not comfortable with it unless it is necessary.

> [{quoted}](name=dArtagnan,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=78Oum4MU,comment-id=000100000000,timestamp=2014-12-15T23:57:47.494+0000)
> I took a look at your logs and two things immediately jump out at me as big red flags:
> 
> 1) Your DxDiag shows you running an integrated Intel Graphics Card.  Do you have an Nvidia or AMD dedicated Graphics Card as well?  Or is it just your integrated card?
> 
> 2) Your R3d Log shows that League of Legends was not able to detect that you have a Graphics Card installed -- which is probably the main reason for the crashes. This usually means the drivers are corrupted/severly out of date.  However, in order to update them, we need to make sure that question #1 is answered.
> 
> Respond back with any information you can so we can dig into this a bit more!

1) yes I have a Nvidia

2) The drivers are up to date according to Nvidia GeForce Experience. Would I know if they are corrupt? How could that be fixed?

If you have an Nvidia Card, we need to make sure that your Integrated card is not used to run League.  There are two ways to do this:

1) Enter your Power Settings and ensure that it is set to "High Performance"

2)  Enter your Nvidia Control Panel (you can just right-click your desktop to find it) to force League to use your Nvidia Card.  Here is a 3rd party resource which can help with that:

http://www.howtogeek.com/175281/how-to-force-graphics-options-in-pc-games-with-nvidia-amd-or-intel-graphics/


As for your drivers themselves, make sure you have downloaded and installed the latest drivers directly from Nvidia:

http://www.geforce.com/drivers

Make sure to select your type of Graphics Card, the exact model of it, and what OS you have.  Once you have searched, download the most recent driver that is displayed and install it.

Respond back and let me know if you are still experiencing issues!

> [{quoted}](name=dArtagnan,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=78Oum4MU,comment-id=00010000000000000000,timestamp=2014-12-16T00:44:21.715+0000)

I just had the game lock up my computer again. Had to reboot. Anything else I can try?

At this point, I still feel that it may be due to a corruption with your drivers.  Follow these steps very carefully to try to clean re-install them:

**NOTE**:  *You may want to create a System Restore point before proceeding.  This can be accomplished by simply navigating to your Start Menu, and typing "create a restore point".  Once the new Restore Point window opens, selecting the "Create" button near the bottom.  A new window will appear asking you to name it.  Simply name it "old drivers" or something related.  Follow the last few prompts to create the restore point.*

Put the latest Nvidia drivers you downloaded earlier somewhere easily accessible on your desktop.

Next, follow these steps:

1) Open your start menu > Control Panel > search for device manager
2) In the device manager follow the tree to: (user name) > Display Adapter > Right click your graphics card and click "properties".
3) In the new window, navigate over to the Driver tab and click the uninstall button at the bottom.  When a new window appears, make sure to select "delete the driver software for this device" before clicking OK
4) Once the driver has been uninstalled you will need to restart and your resolution will likely change to a very low resolution as the computer is now using generic windows drivers for the graphics card.  Rest assured, this is completely normal.

Now that your drivers are completely uninstalled, find that Nvidia driver file that was on your desktop and run/install them.  Once this is accomplished, your computer may need to restart, but your resolution should return to normal. 

If your still having issues, make sure to attach your latest R3d Log!

I downloaded an update for my drivers and switched league to always use my NVidia card, so hopefully this fixes the issue. 

I do greatly appreciate your help (its hard to show it in simple text) and I hope this fixes the issues. Sorry if I posted to much, I was just trying to get as much as I knew up in case it could help :P

This usually means the drivers are corrupted/severly out of date.  However, in order to update them, we need to make sure that question #1 is answered.
> 
> Respond back with any information you can so we can dig into this a bit more!

Also, if I may, I do prefer talking to you over the support person I was emailing. You have explained the possible cause behind the problem to me, which the other person did not. I know a bit about computers, and I might be able to refine some things. I don't know if any of these might be the issue, but maybe you can help? So far, you have been a much better help and I greatly appreciate it.

1) I run league in compatibility mode for windows 7, despite my system being windows 8.1. I can disable this if it might help?

2) I am on a alienware laptop, and the system switches between the intel and NVidia graphics cards for battery power reasons. I do however have a settings tab where I can select which card to use, so if one card is the problem, maybe the other works?

3)this is a bit vague and there is nothing I can figure, but maybe someone who knows code could? the below image shows my R3d folder. There seems to be an average file size for those logs, but the two that exceed 100,000 KB are the two games my computer completely locked up on. If I open them and scroll through, I see the same errors repeating all the way down until it ends, which I assume to be the point at which I shut down my computer?

I also have logs like this. I'm on a desktop PC with the monitor plugged into the video card, though, so there's no way the game could be going through another video device. File is too large to upload to Riot boards. Looking at the log, the game is definitely seeing my Nvidia card. The issues started immediately after 4.21, so it was definitely the patch and not a change to my system.

Hi, iv been having the same issues. Mostly with low fps, though. Ever since the release of patch 4.20 my fps has been significantly lower than before. Can you help me out? Here is my Dxdiag.

Thank you

Your DxDiag seems fairly clean.  Make sure to [submit a ticket](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) to our Tech Team and include the following logs:

1) Your most recent r3d log where you experienced the problem (You'll notice that the file name starts with the date/time and ends with r3dlog.txt): https://support.leagueoflegends.com/entries/27495980-Network-System-and-League-of-Legends-Logs#wq7 

2) Process List: https://support.leagueoflegends.com/entries/27495980-Network-System-and-League-of-Legends-Logs#wq3 

They can take a deeper look into your your computer information to see what the issue could be.

I tried submitting a ticket and they said to reinstall league, which I did, and when the problem was still occurring, I told them and I havnt gotten a reply since. Kind of the reason I ranted, and I do apologize for any hard feelings, im just frustrated and want to {{summoner:11}} these issues already

> [{quoted}](name=Phaselock98,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=78Oum4MU,comment-id=00010001,timestamp=2014-12-15T22:55:57.746+0000)

I don't know for sure if you are having the same issue I had but if you go to Riot Game>League of Legends> config there is a file named game.cfg. deleting this fixed my frame rate issue, although you will have to set up all your settings again.
It literally fixed it for one game.

Ive been having alot of issues with loading in game correctly with Yasuo{{champion:157}}  and it completely crashes every time we get in game and obviously i miss farm off of that little time which sets me back just about every game

Now that you have mentioned it, the game only crashed for me when I played yasuo. Never with any other champion. Now im wondering if there is some correlation? One of my friends also reports bad frame rates when using the Project Yasuo skin. Is this known issue?

EDIT: I can confirm that Yasuo is now the source of my problem. For whatever reason, my game only locks up when I play Yasuo, not any other champion.
I been having issues myself.
